revision.comment: Your chart has error on it, you have represented iPhone 11 Pro with iPhone 11. Also please be conservative in your tagging of sources, it effects the page layout severely. There are many simpler sources you can site from the web

A2218 |logo = IPhone 11 Pro wordmark.svg |logosize = 200px |image = iPhone 11 Pro Midnight Green.svg |caption = iPhone 11 Pro in Midnight Green |imagesize = 200px |brand = [[Apple Inc.]] |serieslabel = [[History of iPhone|Generation]] |series = 13th |announced = September 10, 2019 |preorder = September 13, 2019 |released = {{Start date and age|2019|09|20}} |available = {{Collapsible list|framestyle=border:none; padding:0;|title=September 20, 2019 |[[Austria]] |[[Belgium]] |[[Canada]] |[[China]] |[[Czech Republic]] |[[Denmark]] |[[Finland]] |[[France]] |[[Germany]] |[[Hong Kong]] |[[Republic of Ireland|Ireland]] |[[Italy]] |[[Israel]] |[[Japan]] |[[Mexico]] |[[Netherlands]] |[[New Zealand]] |[[Norway]] |[[Poland]] |[[Portugal]] |[[Russia]] |[[South Africa]] |[[Saudi Arabia]] |[[Singapore]] |[[Slovenia]] |[[Spain]] |[[Sweden]] |[[Switzerland]] |[[Taiwan]] |[[United Arab Emirates]] |[[United Kingdom]] |[[United States]]}} {{Collapsible list|framestyle=border:none; padding:0;|title=September 26, 2019 |[[Israel]]}} {{Collapsible list|framestyle=border:none; padding:0;|title=September 27, 2019 |[[Andorra]] |[[Bahrain]] |[[Brazil]] |[[Bulgaria]] |[[Croatia]] |[[Cyprus]] |[[Estonia]] |[[Georgia (country)|Georgia]] |[[Hungary]] |[[Iceland]] |[[India]] |[[Kuwait]] |[[Latvia]] |[[Liechtenstein]] |[[Luxembourg]] |[[Malaysia]] |[[Malta]] |[[Monaco]] |[[Nigeria]] |[[Oman]] |[[Qatar]] |[[Serbia]] |[[Romania]] |[[Slovakia]] |[[South Africa]]}} {{Collapsible list|framestyle=border:none; padding:0;|title=October 18, 2019 |[[Brazil]] |[[Thailand]]}} {{Collapsible list|framestyle=border:none; padding:0;|title=October 25, 2019 |[[Philippines]] |[[South Korea]] |[[Turkey]]}} {{Collapsible list|framestyle=border:none; padding:0;|title=October 26, 2019 |[[Egypt]]}} {{Collapsible list|framestyle=border:none; padding:0;|title=December 6, 2019 |[[Indonesia]]}} |predecessor = [[iPhone XS|iPhone XS / iPhone XS Max]] |successor = |related = [[iPhone 11]]

{{Current iOS}} |soc = [[Apple A13|A13 Bionic]] |cpu = [[Hexa-core]] (2× high power Lightning cores at 2.66 GHz + 4× low power Thunder cores at 1.82 GHz){{cite web |url=https://www.specenginex.com/spec-apple-iphone11promax.php|title=Apple iPhone 11 Pro Max|publisher=Spec Engine X}}{{Cite web|url=https://www.anandtech.com/show/14859/apple-announces-new-iphone-11-iphone-11-pro-iphone-11-pro-max|title=Apple Announces New iPhone 11, iPhone 11 Pro, & iPhone 11 Pro Max|last=Frumusanu|first=Andrei|website=[[AnandTech]]|access-date=2019-09-23}}{{cite web|url=https://browser.geekbench.com/ios_devices/64|title=iPhone 11 Pro Geekbench|publisher=geekbench.com|access-date=2019-09-26}} |gpu = |modem = [[Dual SIM]] with [[eSIM]]
Gigabit-Class LTE Cat.19 with 4x4 MIMO, up to 30 [[LTE frequency bands|LTE bands]] |memory = 4 GB LPDDR4X RAM{{Cite web|url=https://www.macrumors.com/2019/09/17/iphone-11-pro-max-battery-mah-4gb-ram-tenaa/|title=iPhone 11 Pro Models Have Up to 25 % Larger Batteries and 4 GB of RAM Per Reliable TENAA Filings|access-date=2019-09-18|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190918002119/https://www.macrumors.com/2019/09/17/iphone-11-pro-max-battery-mah-4gb-ram-tenaa/|archive-date=2019-09-18|url-status=live}} |storage = 64, 256 or 512 [[Gigabytes|GB]] |memory_card = None |battery = '''11 Pro''': 3.83 V 11.67 Wh (3046 mAh) [[Lithium-ion battery|Li-ion]]
'''11 Pro Max''': 3.79 V 15.04 Wh (3969 mAh) Li-ion |charging = [[Lightning (connector)|Lightning]] fast charging, [[Qi (standard)|Qi]] wireless charging |input = |display = '''11 Pro:''' {{convert|5.85|in|mm|abbr=on}}, 2436 × 1125 px
'''11 Pro Max:''' {{convert|6.46|in|mm|abbr=on}}, 2688 × 1242 px
'''All models:''' 458 [[Pixel density|ppi]], [[Retina Display|Super Retina XDR]], haptic touch, wide color display ([[DCI-P3]]), true tone display, 800 cd/m2 max. brightness (typical), 1200 cd/m2 max. brightness (HDR), with fingerprint-resistant [[oleophobic]] coating. |ext_display = |rear_camera = 12 MP (1.4 μm) (1/2.55") Sony Exmor IMX356-Inspired, triple-lens (one ƒ/2.4 aperture ultra wide angle lens, one ƒ/1.8 wide angle lens, one ƒ/2.0 telephoto lens), [[Image stabilization#Optical image stabilization|optical image stabilization]], brighter dual-LED flash, autofocus, IR filter, Burst mode, 6-element lens, 4K video recording at 24, 30 or 60 FPS or 1080p at 30 or 60 FPS, slow-motion video (1080p at 120 FPS or 240 FPS), time-lapse with stabilization, panorama (up to 63 megapixels), portrait mode, portrait lighting, face detection, digital image stabilization, stereo audio recording |front_camera = 12 MP, ƒ/2.2 aperture, burst mode, exposure control, face detection, auto-HDR, auto image stabilization, Retina flash, 4K video recording at 24, 30 or 60 FPS or 1080p HD at 30 or 60 FPS, slow-motion video (1080p at 120 FPS) Portrait Mode, Portrait Lighting and Animoji |sound = Stereo speakers with spatial audio and [[Dolby Atmos]] |other = [[FaceTime]] audio- or video-calling, [[IP Code|IP68]] IEC standard 60529 (splash, water, and dust resistant), [[USB-C]] to [[Lightning (connector)|Lightning]], [[GPS]]/[[GNSS]] position, velocity and time. |connectivity = [[2G]], [[3G]], [[4G LTE]], Wi‑Fi 6 ([[802.11ax]]), Bluetooth 5.0 |sar = |hac = |website = {{URL|https://www.apple.com/iphone-11-pro/}} }} {{iPhone models}} The '''iPhone 11 Pro''' and '''iPhone 11 Pro Max''' are [[smartphone]]s designed, developed and marketed by [[Apple Inc.]] They are the [[List of iOS devices|13th-generation]] flagship [[iPhone]]s, succeeding the [[iPhone XS|iPhone XS and iPhone XS Max]], respectively. Apple CEO [[Tim Cook]] unveiled the devices alongside a lower-end model, the [[iPhone 11]], on September 10, 2019, at the [[Steve Jobs Theater]] at [[Apple Park]]. Pre-orders began on September 13, 2019, and the phones went on sale on September 20.{{Cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2019/09/10/technology/iphone-11.html|title=Apple iPhone Event: A Rebranded 'Pro' Phone, the Series 5 Watch, a New iPad|website=|url-status=live|access-date=|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190910184003/https://www.nytimes.com/2019/09/10/technology/iphone-11.html|archive-date=2019-09-10}} Key upgrades over the previous devices include the triple-lens rear camera system and the [[Apple A13|A13 Bionic chip]].{{Cite web|url=https://www.apple.com/newsroom/2019/09/iphone-11-pro-and-iphone-11-pro-max-the-most-powerful-and-advanced-smartphones/|title=iPhone 11 Pro and iPhone 11 Pro Max: the most powerful and advanced smartphones|website=[[Apple Inc.|Apple Newsroom]]|language=en-US|access-date=2019-09-10|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190910185030/https://www.apple.com/newsroom/2019/09/iphone-11-pro-and-iphone-11-pro-max-the-most-powerful-and-advanced-smartphones/|archive-date=2019-09-10|url-status=live}} The 11 Pro is Apple's first iPhone to feature a "pro" designation, which was previously used only for larger Apple devices, such as the [[iPad Pro]] and [[MacBook Pro]],{{Cite web|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/life-style/gadgets-and-tech/news/iphone-11-pro-apple-release-date-a9099841.html|title=iPhone 11 Pro: release date, price and details released about new premium Apple handset|last=Griffin|first=Andrew|website=[[The Independent]]|url-status=live|access-date=|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190911191130/https://www.independent.co.uk/life-style/gadgets-and-tech/news/iphone-11-pro-apple-release-date-a9099841.html|archive-date=2019-09-11}} and the first to include in the box an 18 W fast charger and a [[Lightning (connector)|Lightning]] to [[USB-C]] cable that allows connection to current [[Macintosh|Mac computers]].{{Cite web|url=https://www.engadget.com/2019/09/10/iphone-11-pro-max-fast-charger/|title=Apple finally includes a fast charger with the iPhone 11 Pro|website=[[Engadget]]|language=en|access-date=2019-09-10|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190911120444/https://www.engadget.com/2019/09/10/iphone-11-pro-max-fast-charger/|archive-date=2019-09-11|url-status=live}} == History == Details regarding the smartphone were leaked widely starting several months before the official release, with complete specifications, renderings, and real-life images of the phone being publicized, many of which turned out to be correct, such as advancements in the camera and the continuation of the 'notch' design from the frontal camera featured since the [[iPhone X]].{{cite news|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/life-style/gadgets-and-tech/news/iphone-11-pro-apple-release-date-details-features-rumours-latest-update-a9074481.html|title=Apple is about to launch a huge range of new products – here's what they are|last1=Griffin|first1=Andrew|date=22 August 2019|work=The Independent|accessdate=27 August 2019|language=en}}{{cite web|url=https://www.whathifi.com/advice/iphone-11-release-date-price-specs-and-latest-news-for-the-new-iphones|title=iPhone 11: release date, price and leaks for the new iPhone|website=WhatHiFi|language=en|accessdate=27 August 2019}} However, some leaks turned out to be incorrect, such as the inclusion of bilateral charging.{{Cite web|url=https://9to5mac.com/2019/09/23/iphone-11-teardown/|title=iPhone 11 teardown reveals lack of bilateral wireless charging evidence, same logic board as Pro models, more|last=Potuck|first=Michael|date=2019-09-23|website=9to5Mac|language=en-US|access-date=2020-02-15}}{{Cite web|url=https://www.pcmag.com/news/iphone-11-rumor-roundup-what-you-need-to-know|title=iPhone 11 Rumor Roundup: What You Need to Know|website=PCMAG|language=en|access-date=2020-02-15}} Official release event invites sent out to press featured layered colored glass elements organized to form the Apple logo, which some reviewers drew similarities to Apple's original logo, suggesting new colors for the phone, and to a patent Apple filed for a new camera design earlier.{{Cite web|url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/tech/iphone-11-launch-date-confirmed-19163964|title=iPhone 11 launch date confirmed as Apple sends out invitation to 'special event'|last=Curtis|first=Sophie|date=2019-09-02|website=mirror|access-date=2019-10-16}}{{Cite web|url=https://www.inverse.com/article/58961-iphone-11-apple-event-invite-may-hint-at-the-future-of-smartphone-cameras|title=iPhone 11: Apple Event Invite May Hint at the Future of Smartphone Cameras|last=Brown|first=Mike|website=Inverse|language=en|access-date=2019-10-16}} The iPhone 11 and 11 Pro were unveiled in a press event at the [[Steve Jobs Theater]] in Cupertino, California on September 10, 2019; that was the first Apple event livestreamed on YouTube.{{Cite web|url=https://www.cnet.com/news/apple-to-stream-iphone-11-pro-event-on-youtube/|title=Apple to stream iPhone 11 Pro event on YouTube|last=Musil|first=Steven|website=CNET|language=en|access-date=2020-02-15}} The event featured various other products and services other than the iPhone, including a new Apple Watch, a new iPad, Apple TV+, and Apple Arcade.{{Cite web|url=https://www.digitaltrends.com/mobile/everything-apple-announced-at-september-2019-iphone-event/|title=Apple’s September 2019 event: Here’s absolutely everything announced|last=Jansen|first=Mark|work=[[Digital Trends]]|date=2019-09-10|access-date=2020-02-15}} Pre-orders began on September 13, with the iPhone 11 Pro starting from a base price of $999, and the larger screen Pro Max starting from $1,099. The phones were released on September 20.{{Cite web|url=https://www.businessinsider.com/how-to-pre-order-iphone-11|title=The iPhone 11 is here — here's how to order it and the best trade-in deals|last=Chin|first=Monica|website=Business Insider|access-date=2020-02-15}} ==Design== [[File:Scan of back of iPhone 11 Pro Max Space Grey.jpg|thumb|top|upright|The back side of the iPhone 11 Pro Max in Space Grey.]] The iPhone 11 Pro is available in Gold, Silver, Space Gray, and Midnight Green, a new color previously not available on iPhones.{{Cite web|url=https://www.apple.com/iphone-11-pro/specs/|title=iPhone 11 Pro – Technical Specifications – Apple|access-date=2019-09-13|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190914011954/https://www.apple.com/iphone-11-pro/specs/|archive-date=2019-09-14|url-status=live}} Similar to the iPhone XS, there is a display cutout at the front that includes the 12 MP [[TrueDepth]] camera system and speaker. There is also a new rear camera design with three lenses and a flash in a larger, square-shaped bump, which is the most visible difference compared to the iPhone XS.{{Cite web|url=https://www.pocket-lint.com/phones/news/apple/149318-iphone-11-colors-colours-pro|title=iPhone 11 colors: All the iPhone 11 and 11 Pro colors available|last=Pocket-lint|date=2019-09-11|website=Pocket-lint|language=en|access-date=2019-09-11|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190911024528/https://www.pocket-lint.com/phones/news/apple/149318-iphone-11-colors-colours-pro|archive-date=2019-09-11|url-status=live}}{{Cite web|url=https://www.apple.com/iphone-11-pro/specs/|title=iPhone 11 Pro – Technical Specifications|website=[[Apple Inc.]]|language=en-US|access-date=2019-09-10|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190910184851/https://www.apple.com/iphone-11-pro/specs/|archive-date=2019-09-10|url-status=live}} The Apple logo is now centered on the back of the device with no text, and the glass has a frosted matte finish, unlike the glossy finish found on other glass-backed iPhones. {| class="wikitable" |- !Color !!Name |- |bgcolor="EBEBE3"| ||Silver |- |bgcolor="535150"| ||Space Gray |- |bgcolor="FAD7BD"| ||Gold |- |bgcolor="4E5851"| ||Midnight Green |} ==Specifications== ===Hardware=== The iPhone 11 Pro and Pro Max both have an [[Apple A13|A13 Bionic]] processor. Both phones have three internal storage options: 64 GB, 256 GB, and 512 GB, and have 4 GB of RAM.{{cite web |url=https://www.specenginex.com/spec-apple-iphone11promax.php|title=Apple iPhone 11 Pro Max|publisher=Spec Engine X}} Both models are rated IP68 water and dust resistant, and are resistant for 30 minutes at a depth of 4 meters. The warranty does not cover any water damage to the phone. Also, like previous iPhones, both phones do not have a headphone jack, and come with wired EarPods with a Lightning connector. The iPhone 11 Pro is the first iPhone to be sold with an 18 watt fast charger in the box as opposed to the 5 watt charger in the iPhone XS and previous iPhones.{{Cite web|url=https://www.macworld.com/article/3437999/iphone-11-vs-iphone-11-prosspecs-features-colors-price.html|title=iPhone 11 vs 11 Pro|website=[[Macworld]]|access-date=2019-09-11|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190912192731/https://www.macworld.com/article/3437999/iphone-11-vs-iphone-11-prosspecs-features-colors-price.html|archive-date=2019-09-12|url-status=live}} ====Display==== The iPhone 11 Pro has a 5.85 inch (marketed as 5.8 inch) [[OLED]] display with a resolution of 2436 × 1125 pixels (2.7 megapixels at 458 ppi), while the iPhone 11 Pro Max has a 6.46 inch (marketed as 6.5 inch) OLED display with a resolution of 2688 × 1242 pixels (3.3 megapixels at 458 ppi). Both models feature a [[Retina display|Super Retina XDR Display]] with a 2,000,000:1 contrast ratio and a notch at the top for the TrueDepth camera system and speaker. Apple describes the display as having a "mini [[Apple Pro Display XDR]]" on a phone. They also have a True Tone and wide color display supporting HDR with 800 nits of standard brightness and 1200 nits peak brightness if necessary. The screen has an oleophobic coating that is fingerprint-resistant. The display of the iPhone 11 Pro and iPhone 11 Pro Max is made by [[Samsung Electronics|Samsung]].{{Cite web|url=http://www.theinvestor.co.kr/view.php?ud=20191022000805|title=Samsung increases OLED supply for Apple’s latest iPhones|website=www.theinvestor.co.kr|language=en|access-date=2019-12-21}}{{Cite web|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/ewanspence/2019/10/23/apple-iphone-11-success-victory-win-samsung-screen-oled-competition/|title=Apple's iPhone 11 Success Gifts Samsung A Hidden Victory|last=Spence|first=Ewan|website=Forbes|language=en|access-date=2019-12-21}}{{Cite web|url=https://pocketnow.com/apple-increases-iphone-11-pro-panel-orders-from-samsung-display|title=Apple increases iPhone 11 Pro panel orders from Samsung Display|last=Nagy|first=Anton D.|language=en-US|access-date=2019-12-21}} ====Camera==== The iPhone 11 Pro and Pro Max both include a triple-lens 12 MP rear camera array. There is one ƒ/2.4 ultra wide angle lens with a 120 degree field of view and 2x optical zoom out, one ƒ/1.8 wide angle lens, and one ƒ/2.0 telephoto lens with 2x optical zoom in. There is a burst mode, image stabilization, [[High dynamic range|HDR]] and a portrait mode with supporting an advanced bokeh effect. The phones support a Portrait Mode supporting depth control and an advanced [[bokeh]] effect. The phone also has an automatic Night Mode allowing the camera to take brighter pictures with reduced noise in low light environments. There is also a redesigned camera app that adds new features such as a scroll wheel for choosing between the different lenses and long-pressing the shutter button to take a video. Apple has also announced a new Deep Fusion feature which will take advantage of AI and machine learning for image processing.{{Cite web|url=https://www.macrumors.com/roundup/iphone-11-pro/|title=iPhone 11 Pro Roundup|website=[[Macrumors]]|url-status=live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190911214845/https://www.macrumors.com/roundup/iphone-11-pro/|archive-date=2019-09-11|access-date=2019-09-11}} The iPhone 11 Pro supports [[4K resolution|4K video]] up to 60 fps and 1080p slow motion at up to 240 fps. However, Apple limits the full range of zoom (0.5x -6x) while shooting in 4K @ 60fps to either 0.5x - 1.5x or 1x to 2x depending which lens is selected upon recording. All other resolutions/frame rates support the full zoom set. The phone also features an audio zoom feature which focuses audio on the area that is being zoomed in on. All of the cameras support video although only the wide and telephoto come with [[Image stabilization#Optical image stabilization|optical image stabilization]]. Video can be captured with multiple cameras at the same time, through the multi camera recording feature.{{Cite web|url=https://www.ubergizmo.com/2019/09/iphone-11-pro-multi-camera-come-to-older-iphones/|title=iPhone 11 Pro's Multi-Camera Video Recording Feature Will Be Coming To Older iPhones|last=PDT|first=Tyler Lee on 09/16/2019 17:09|website=Ubergizmo|language=en|access-date=2019-09-21|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190919134001/https://www.ubergizmo.com/2019/09/iphone-11-pro-multi-camera-come-to-older-iphones/|archive-date=2019-09-19|url-status=live}} Both models also have a 12 MP TrueDepth front camera with a ƒ/2.0 aperture. The front camera also supports stabilized 4K video recording up to 60fps. Apple has added slow motion video recording to the front camera in 1080p at up to 120 fps, a feature which Apple refers to as "slofies". Similar to previous iPhone models, the TrueDepth system is also used for Face ID and Animoji. ===Software=== {{See also|iOS 13|iOS version history}} The iPhone 11 Pro and Pro Max initially shipped with the [[iOS 13]] operating system. The phone also comes with [[Siri]], [[Face ID]] (through the TrueDepth camera), [[Apple Pay]], and supports [[Apple Card]]. ==Reception== Upon release, the iPhone 11 Pro received generally positive reviews, with critics highlighting the improvements to the camera, display, and battery, although it was criticized for its similar design to the iPhone XS and the large camera bump, as well as the lack of rumored features such as bilateral wireless charging and USB-C. [[TechRadar]] critics praised the improved camera array, calling it "clearly the big upgrade", and also praised the faster [[Apple A13|A13 Bionic]] processor, and the display, while criticizing the design similarities compared to the [[iPhone XS]] including display cut-out for the sensor housing, commonly referred to as "the notch," and also criticizing the cost.{{Cite web|url=https://www.techradar.com/reviews/hands-on-iphone-11-max-review|title=Hands on: Hands on: iPhone 11 Pro Max review|last=Beavis|first=Gareth |website=[[TechRadar]]|language=en|access-date=2019-09-11|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190911215147/https://www.techradar.com/reviews/hands-on-iphone-11-max-review|archive-date=2019-09-11|url-status=live}}{{Cite web|url=https://www.tomsguide.com/reviews/iphone-11-pro|title=iPhone 11 Pro Hands-on Review|last=Phones|first=Mark Spoonauer 2019-09-11T13:24:44Z|website=Tom's Guide|language=en|access-date=2019-09-11|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190911022037/https://www.tomsguide.com/reviews/iphone-11-pro|archive-date=2019-09-11|url-status=live}} Pocket Lint also positively described the camera, the processor, display, and battery, camera design, and lack of bilateral wireless charging.{{Cite web|url=https://www.pocket-lint.com/phones/reviews/apple/149324-apple-iphone-11-pro-max-review|title=Apple iPhone 11 Pro Max initial review|last=Pocket-lint|date=2019-09-11|website=Pocket-lint|language=en|access-date=2019-09-11|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190911024912/https://www.pocket-lint.com/phones/reviews/apple/149324-apple-iphone-11-pro-max-review|archive-date=2019-09-11|url-status=live}}{{Cite web|url=https://www.pocket-lint.com/phones/reviews/apple/149323-iphone-11-pro-review|title=Apple iPhone 11 Pro initial review|last=Pocket-lint|date=2019-09-11|website=Pocket-lint|language=en|access-date=2019-09-11|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190911025010/https://www.pocket-lint.com/phones/reviews/apple/149323-iphone-11-pro-review|archive-date=2019-09-11|url-status=live}} [[The Verge]] and [[T3 (magazine)|T3]] positively described the general aspects of the phone, while stating that the 'pro' label may not be fully justified as the phone only helps Apple keep up with the competitors, not surpass them.{{Cite web|url=https://www.theverge.com/2019/9/10/20857971/apple-iphone-11-pro-max-hands-on-features-photos-video-camera-price|title=iPhone 11 Pro and 11 Pro Max: hands-on with Apple's new flagship phones|last=Bohn|first=Dieter|date=2019-09-10|website=[[The Verge]]|access-date=2019-09-11|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190911072053/https://www.theverge.com/2019/9/10/20857971/apple-iphone-11-pro-max-hands-on-features-photos-video-camera-price|archive-date=2019-09-11|url-status=live}}{{Cite web|url=https://www.t3.com/news/iphone-11-pro-review-early-verdict-apple-tries-to-go-pro-with-a-triple-lens-camera|title=iPhone 11 Pro review (early verdict): Apple tries to go pro with a triple-lens camera|last=Jones 2019-09-11T10:13:57Z|first=Robert|website=[[T3 (magazine)|T3]]|language=en|access-date=2019-09-11|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190912222739/https://www.t3.com/news/iphone-11-pro-review-early-verdict-apple-tries-to-go-pro-with-a-triple-lens-camera|archive-date=2019-09-12|url-status=live}} The device received an overall score of 117 from [[DXOMARK]], ranking it as the second-best smartphone camera on the site tied with the Samsung Galaxy Note 10+. An 11-point improvement over its predecessor, it had a photo score of 124 and a video score of 102.{{Cite web|url=https://www.dxomark.com/apple-iphone-11-pro-max-camera-review/|title=iPhone 11 Pro Max camera review|work=[[DXOMARK]]|last=Rehm|first=Lars|date=7 November 2019|accessdate=7 November 2019}} ==Timeline of iPhone models== {{Timeline of iPhone models}} ==Environmental Data== ===Carbon Footprint=== [[File:IPhone 11 Pro Carbon Footprint.jpg|thumb|Carbon Footprint of an iPhone 11 Pro in KG CO2]] The iPhone 11 Pro has a carbon footprint of 80 kg CO2e emissions which is 2 kg more than the preceding iPhone XS and 25 kg more than the iPhone 3G in 2008. 83% of the emissions are caused by the production of the device and primary resources while remaining emissions are caused by transportation and first use.{{cite web | author-link =Apple Inc.| title = Environmental Report iPhone 3G (2008)| publisher = Apple Inc.| url = https://www.apple.com/environment/pdf/products/archive/2009/iPhone-3G-Environmental-Report.pdf}}{{cite web | author-link =Apple Inc. | title = Environmental Report iPhone 11 Pro (2019)| publisher = Apple Inc. | url = https://www.apple.com/br/environment/pdf/products/iphone/iPhone_11_Pro_PER_sept2019.pdf}} ===Repairability=== The iPhone 11 Pro and Pro Max continues the strategy of discouraging customers to seek 3rd party repairs while rendering repairs with Apple more costly: repair with non authentic parts such as batteries or displays can trigger warning messages on the phone instigating the customer to visit a certified technician to replace the respective parts with genuine ones. While the website clearly states that the phone will function properly despite the warning, this information is not passed in the context of the warning. Even if batteries are properly functioning and at full capacity the customers are prompted by a message on the phone to replace the battery.{{cite web |title=Apple Is Locking iPhone Batteries to Discourage Repair |url=https://www.ifixit.com/News/32343/apple-is-locking-batteries-to-iphones-now |website=I Fix It |publisher=I Fix It |accessdate=2 June 2020 |date=7 August 2019}} At the same time battery replacement with original spareparts saw a hike in pricing: after initially discounting battery replacements to $29 following the [[Batterygate|Battery Gate Scandal]], battery replacement prices for all flagship iPhone models hiked to 69.00US$.{{cite web |title=iPhone Battery Replacement Costs |url=https://support.apple.com/iphone/repair/service/battery-power |website=apple.com |publisher=Apple Inc. |accessdate=2 June 2020}} ==See also== * [[Comparison of smartphones]] * [[History of iPhone]] * [[List of iOS devices]] ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * {{Official website|https://www.apple.com/iphone-11-pro|iPhone 11 Pro}} – official site {{iOS}} {{Apple hardware since 1998}} {{Apple Inc. hardware}} {{Apple}} [[Category:IPhone|*]] [[Category:IOS]] [[Category:Mobile phones introduced in 2019]] [[Category:Computer-related introductions in 2019]] [[Category:Phones with multiple rear cameras]]
